Body:
A friend of mine posted the following on his Facebook wall:

I'm paraphrasing myself when I say this...

I know this isn't a paradox, is it autological? Is it recursive? Is it even a true statement? If he had said "I'm expressing myself when I say this...", it's at least self-descriptive, but I'm not sure when it comes to "paraphrasing" because that seems to imply a shortening of the original statement. Can anyone shed some light on this?
Title: Is "I'm paraphrasing myself when I say this..." autological?

OwnerUser.AboutMe: Senior Software Engineer, Cat5 Commerce St. Louis, MO
